title: Israel Partially Reopens Rafah Crossing for Limited Movement
snippets: Palestinians have reunited with loved ones in Gaza after Israel allowed a partial reopening of the Rafah crossing.
Only 12 Palestinians entered Gaza through Rafah while five patients and their escorts were allowed to leave for Egypt.

Dozens of Palestinians were expected to leave or return to Gaza on Monday after Israel reopened the sole pedestrian crossing to Egypt, a major step in the ceasefire intended to end the war, though with strict limitations on access.

Numbers Israel permitted to enter Egypt after reopening border were far lower than expected following delays A small number of sick and wounded Palestinians have begun crossing into Egypt to seek medical treatment after Israel permitted a limited reopening of the Palestinian territory’s Rafah border
Israel and Egypt had disagreed for months about how to resume operations at the Rafah border crossing, which has been largely closed since May 2024.
The only crossing that connects Gaza with Egypt has reopened. The move will allow residents to leave for medical care or return to homes and families in the territory.
Israeli troops seized the Rafah border crossing in May 2024. The reopening marks progress toward the second phase of the U.S.-backed ceasefire deal.
titles: Palestinians return to Gaza after limited Rafah crossing reopening
Trickle of Palestinians get to leave, enter Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens
Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt reopens, with strict limits
Handful of sick and wounded Palestinians allowed through Rafah crossing on first day
Rafah Crossing in Gaza Reopens, Another Step for Fragile Cease-Fire
What to Know About the Rafah Border Crossing in Gaza
Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt reopens after nearly two years
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the situation in Gaza and the Rafah crossing, contributing to readers' understanding of the ongoing Israeli-Palestinian conflict. However, it could provide more context or analysis to fully explain the significance of the Rafah crossing reopening.
summary: Israel has partially reopened the Rafah crossing between Gaza and Egypt, allowing 12 Palestinians to enter Gaza and five patients with escorts to leave for medical care in Egypt. The reopening, following months of dispute with Egypt, is a step in the U.S.-backed ceasefire process, though movement remains strictly limited.

title: NHL Stars Mammoth and Predators Among Teams Secure Wins on Feb. 3
snippets: William Nylander scored his 18th goal of the season and added two assists to lead the Toronto Maple Leafs to a 4-2 NHL victory over the Calgary Flames on Monday.
William Nylander had a huge night with a goal and two assists and Joseph Woll stood on his head late, finishing with 28 saves as the Toronto Maple Leafs held on to defeat the Calgary Flames 4-2.

Kirill Kaprizov scored a pair of goals, including tallying the OT winner, and Quinn Hughes extended his assist streak to nine games with three helpers as the Minnesota Wild edged the Montreal Canadiens 4-3.

Tim Stutzle scored and added an assist, Drake Batherson dished out two assists of his own, and Claude Giroux scored the game-winning goal in the third period to lead the Ottawa Senators to a 3-2 win over the Pittsburgh Penguins.
Nick Schmaltz scored a hat trick and added an assist to lead the Utah Mammoth to a 6-2 win against the Vancouver Canucks.
Thomas Harley scored the game-winning goal in overtime to lift the Dallas Stars to a 4-3 win over the Winnipeg Jets.

Ilya Mikheyev and Ryan Donato each finished with four points, Connor Murphy added a goal and an assist, while Jason Dickinson dished out two assists of his own to lead the Chicago Blackhawks to a 6-3 win over the San Jose Sharks.
Jason Zucker scored the game-winning goal and Rasmus Dahlin tallied a pair of assists to help the Buffalo Sabres pick up a 5-3 win against the Florida Panthers.
Steven Stamkos scored the tying and go-ahead goal, and Ryan O’Reilly supplied another pair of goals as the Nashville Predators rallied from four down to defeat the St. Louis Blues 6-5.
Lucas Raymond put up a goal and an assist, Dylan Larkin notched two assists, and John Gibson recorded a 22-save shutout to lead the Detroit Red Wings to a 2-0 win over the Colorado Avalanche.
Nic Dowd finished with a goal and an assist while Clay Stevenson gave up just one goal and made 29 saves to elevate the Washington Capitals to a 4-1 win over the New York Islanders.
titles: Nylander nets 3 points as Leafs outlast Flames 4-2

Notable performances included Nick Schmaltz's hat trick for Utah and comeback wins by Nashville and Minnesota in overtime.

title: NASA's Orion Spacecraft at Launch Pad
snippets: NASA's Orion spacecraft sits atop the agency's SLS (Space Launch System) rocket at the launch pad after rollout on Jan. 17, 2026.

NASA’s Orion spacecraft, which will carry the Artemis II crew around the Moon, sits at the launch pad on Jan. 17, 2026, after rollout. It rests atop the SLS (Space Launch System) rocket.
